author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Madras High Court on Thursday directed the Tiruvallur District Collector to consider a representation to remove encroachments near a lake in Thirumullaivoyal within two months.

The First Bench comprising Chief Justice S.K. Kaul and Justice M.M. Sundresh, passed the order on a public interest litigation (PIL) moved by activist ‘Traffic’ K.R. Ramaswamy on Nov.3, 2014.

Anti-social elements

According to Mr. Ramaswamy, the Arafath Lake situated at Sozhambedu Village in Thirumullaivoyal has been in existence for several decades.

But it was encroached by anti-social elements.

“Due to the encroachments water resource in the area is dwindling which may lead to water scarcity in the locality," the petitioner said.

Village residents had sent several representations to the Chief Minister’s cell and other authorities concerned, but no action has been taken so far,” the petitioner added in the PIL.

Order on a PIL moved by activist ‘Traffic’ K.R. Ramaswamy on Nov.3, 2014
title: HC suggests removal of encroachment on Thirumullaivoyal lake
